person.persName: John Young Brown (Hardin County, Kentucky, attorney and US House Rep, )

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Hardin County, Kentucky, native. Son of Elizabeth Brown. Married to Rebecca Dixon Brown. Father of Elizabeth Cabell Brown, Archibald Dixon Brown, John Young Brown, Jr., Virginia Singleton Brown, Susan Dixon Brown, and Evelyn Brown. Married twice to Lucy Barbee Brown. Educated at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1857. Practiced law in Elizabethtown and Louisville. Democratic member from the Fifth Congressional District of Kentucky of the United States House of Representatives from 1860 to 1861, not serving until the second session due to the House age requirement. Member of the Stephen A. Douglas National Committee in 1860. Elected to the Second Congressional District of Kentucky as a Democratic member of the United States House of Representative from 1866, but denied his seat due to a charge of disloyalty during the Civil War.
